Raw_Text:
Refresh our consumers and
customers. Make a
difference.
We make, move and sell the world’s most loved drinks. With global icons like Coca-Cola, Sprite, Fanta and Monster and local favourites like Mezzo Mix, Urge and L&P – we refresh consumers and create value for our customers.
We do this through our great brands, great people and great execution with our customers. All done sustainably by managing our environmental and societal impact responsibly.
€20bn annual revenue
600m
consumersable to enjoy our products across our markets
4m
customersHelping 4 million customers grow across our markets
Creating value for customers,
growing with our stakeholders
We combine great brands, great people and great execution in the market to refresh consumers and create value for customers. And we do all of this in the most sustainable way possible.
Our strategy aims to deliver sustainable revenue and profit growth for our business and shareholders. At the same time, we support the communities we live and work in. And we grow with our people, partners and stakeholders.
Click + on the cans below to find out more.
Great brands
From soft drinks to water, sports, energy, tea, coffee and alcohol ready-to-drink. We have a product for everyone with or without sugar.
Whether that is a global icon like Coca-Cola, Sprite, Fanta and Monster or a local favourites like Mezzo Mix, Urge and L&P.
Great people
Our 41,000 colleagues share a passion for making, moving and selling the world’s most loved drinks.
Our colleagues are committed to supporting our customers. We’re locally minded, pouring the same passion into our brands as we do our partnerships, quality and execution.
Great execution
We work closely with customers to find exciting ways to bring our drinks to consumers – wherever they are buying them.
We created more value for customers than any other fast moving consumer goods brand in 2024. All through our great execution.
Done sustainably
We’re moving forward on sustainability by using our business and our brands to build a better shared future.
Our sustainability action plan sits at the heart of our business strategy and focuses on the topics where we can make the biggest difference.
We deliver sustainable revenue & profit
growth.
CCEP is a leader in a big and growing category, worth €175 billion across our markets today.
We’re expanding into new markets, innovating in our portfolio of drinks and serving consumers through emerging channels. And we do all of this is close alignment with our strategic partners, including The Coca-Cola Company and Monster Energy Corporation.
With a strong track record of investing in key areas, we have a platform for growth today and into the future.

Creating value
for our customers
Customer benefits
Keep in touch 24/7
Whether it is about your CCEP equipment or you need some information, get in touch. Access this service anytime, from anywhere, on any device.
Where we operate
A global business, with a broad and balanced geographic footprint, serving 4 million customers in 31 markets. MyCCEP has launched in certain European markets, as well as Indonesia.

Our Suppliers
Building success with our suppliers
Everything we do is made possible by the partnerships we’ve built with our 14,000 suppliers.
These long term relationships bring vital innovation to our supply chain. They’re essential for helping us deliver long term, sustainable growth.

1950
In 1953, The Coca-Cola Company partnered with the Daurella family to create the first bottling plant in Barcelona, Spain. Across the 1950s, The Coca-Cola Company expanded throughout Spain, opening plants in Valencia, Tenerife, Palma de Mallorca and Bilbao.

By clicking “Accept All Cookies”, you agree to the storing of cookies on your device to enhance site navigation, analyze site usage, and assist in our marketing efforts. Cookie Notice
Privacy Preference Center
When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer. For more information read the CCEP Cookie notice at the bottom of each page in this site.
Cookie Notice
Manage Consent Preferences
Strictly Necessary Cookies
Always Active
These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.
Functional Cookies
These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.
Performance Cookies
These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is de-identified. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.
Targeting Cookies
These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.

CCEP Q3 2025 Trading Update
Today we published our Q3 2025 trading update. Find out more about our performance in the third quarter of the year, and hear from our CEO Damian Gammell.
“2025 continues to be a solid year for CCEP, reflecting our great brands, great people, great execution and strong relationships with our brand partners and customers. We’ve delivered another quarter of volume growth in Europe, despite softer consumer demand. We continue to drive underlying growth in APS, excluding portfolio changes in Australia, and despite macro driven challenges in Indonesia.
"We’re leading the way in creating value for our customers and growing share ahead of the market, delivering solid gains in revenue per unit case through effective revenue and margin growth management, balancing premiumisation with affordability.
“Although the global macroeconomic environment remains volatile, we remain resilient, operating in attractive and growing categories. We have strong plans for the rest of the year and beyond, including exciting collaborations with the English Premier League and Star Wars.
"Our performance, coupled with our continued focus on productivity, is driving strong and profitable cash generation, supporting record investment in future growth, a growing dividend and ongoing share buybacks. We’re pleased to reaffirm our full-year guidance and remain confident we have the right strategy, done sustainably, to deliver on our mid-term growth objectives.” Damian Gammell CEO, Coca-Cola Europacific Partners

Lights, Camera, Execution: CCEP at the Movies
This Halloween, Fanta is cranking up the scare factor with a limited-edition takeover featuring some of the most iconic horror movie characters ever.
Thanks to our partnership with Universal Pictures and Blumhouse, Chucky, Freddy Fazbear, The Grabber, and M3GAN are jumping off the screen and onto Fanta packs across CCEP markets.
It’s a spine-tingling campaign designed to immerse consumers in Halloween magic - and at CCEP, we’re making sure it delivers real value for our customers, especially in cinemas.

From source to shelf: follow the story of a bottle
Come behind-the-scenes with us as we follow a Coca-Cola bottle from factory floor to fridge door.
Delivering to customers
Our products leave our warehouses and head to our customers – this can be via distribution centres and wholesalers, for example, but distribution models vary depending on the market.
Did you know? We have 189 warehouses across our operations.
End customer
We work with our customers to ensure we are providing great drinks and great execution – every day. We equip our teams with powerful data and digital tools. For example, algorithms help us decide which outlets to visit, in what order, and what to prioritise on each call. Once in-store, our representatives have what they need at their fingertips, so they know what’s selling, what needs restocking, and where there’s opportunity to do more. Creating value for all our customers.
Recycle, reuse, collect
We are working to recycle, reuse and collect more of our packaging, to drive circularity and make sure that it doesn't end up as litter or in the oceans. To help us do this we are:
- Removing unnecessary packaging
- Working towards 100% collection so that packaging can be recycled or reused
- Increasing the amount of recycled material we use in our packaging
- Innovating in refillable and dispense solutions

A global business with local heritage and execution
In Belgium, we responded to local taste preferences by producing a sparkling Fuze Tea for this market.
And same goes for pack formats, where multipacks are particularly popular, so we offer a 6-pack.
In Australia, we partner with the Warrior Women Foundation to mentor young women leaving out-of-home care, helping them build skills for the future. And in Norway, we work with the Red Cross to equip young people with job-readiness skills.
We also empower our people to give back through our volunteering initiative, encouraging volunteering during work hours. In 2024, our employees gave over 41,800 hours to local causes.
And in times of crisis, we step up.
The Philippines faces over 30 natural disasters a year. Coca-Cola Europacific Aboitiz Philippines is a first responder, helping communities recover. In 2024, we donated over 91,000 litres of water to support emergency relief efforts.

CCEP invests in heating innovation with HotGreen Solutions
Find out why we're investing in ultra-efficient heat pump technology.
Innovation in action
HotGreen's heat pumps use electricity to transfer residual heat from one environment (like warmth in the outside air or under the ground) to a production site's existing pipework, acting like a giant reverse refrigerator.
Electricity is used to compress a refrigerant, which absorbs heat from the source and then releases it inside the facility to power essential processes.
Crucially, HotGreen's heat pumps are four times more energy efficient than a traditional boiler.
What's next?
We're delighted that our Ventures team is working directly with the founders of HotGreen and will be exploring the possibility of trialling their technology within our own supply chain.
Watch this space!
We see real impact potential in HotGreen's approach to energy-efficient heating – which aligns with our own sustainability ambitions. We’re excited to see how their innovation could help accelerate us towards our 2040 net zero targets. Sashidar Rajendra Associate Director, Ventures
This funding milestone is a significant step toward our mission to help industrial plants save cost while cutting carbon. Despite rising energy bills and the substantial carbon footprint associated with industrial heat, HotGreen has been set up to address a clear unmet need for a low-carbon, commercially-viable solutions that industry could adopt at scale. Georgia Ware CEO, HotGreen

Wanta Fanta This Halloween? Meet the Monsters
Fanta’s Halloween editions have become a much-anticipated seasonal tradition, designed to bring fun, surprise, and collectability to consumers each year. This year, Fanta is teaming up with Universal Pictures and Blumhouse to unleash a limited edition Halloween takeover featuring some of the most iconic horror movie characters of all time.
From creepy dolls to haunted animatronics, these classic Halloween monsters are crashing on to Fanta packs across our markets - and each one brings their own Fanta flavour. Say hello to Fanta's Fearsome Foursome:
· Chucky on Fanta Forest Berries Zero Sugar
· Freddy Fazbear on Fanta Orange Zero Sugar
· The Grabber on Fruit Twist and Fruit Twist Zero Sugar
· M3GAN on Fanta Lemon
Chucky
M3GAN
Freddy Fazbear
The Grabber
These famous horror characters are here to haunt your fridge - and your taste buds. Feeling brave? Keep reading to meet the monsters behind the cans.
Why Fanta + Halloween?
Halloween is bigger than ever, and Fanta is the soft drink of choice for spooky celebrations. Our partnership with Universal Pictures and Blumhouse lets us bring famous horror movie characters to life in a way that’s fun, bold, and perfect for Gen Z and nostalgic fans alike.
Whether you’re into classic horror movie characters, cartoon horror characters, or just love a good scare, this limited edition Halloween line-up is for you.
What is Wanta Fanta?
Wanta Fanta is more than a campaign - it’s a vibe. It’s about choosing joy, embracing what you want, and cracking open a cold, fizzy burst of flavour that makes you smile. Sometimes, all it takes is one question: Wanta?
Who is Chucky?
The original Chucky doll - aka Charles Lee Ray - is a twisted serial killer who used voodoo to trap his soul inside a Good Guy toy. Since his debut in Child’s Play (1988), Chucky has become one of the most famous horror characters ever, known for his wicked grin and razor-sharp one-liners.
Find him this Halloween on Fanta Forest Berries Zero Sugar, a limited edition Fanta flavour as bold as he is.
Who is Freddy Fazbear?
Straight from Five Nights at Freddy’s, Freddy Fazbear is a haunted animatronic bear who stalks night guards in a cursed pizza joint. Don’t let the cuddly look fool you - he’s one of the scariest Halloween monsters in gaming history.
Grab Freddy on Fanta Orange Zero Sugar, and check out the Freddy Fazbear toys and figures haunting shelves this season.
Who is The Grabber?
The Grabber is a masked predator from The Black Phone, known for his eerie silence and terrifying basement. He’s one of the best horror characters to emerge in recent years - and he’s back in The Black Phone 2, hitting cinemas this October.
Find him on Fanta Fruit Twist and Fruit Twist Zero Sugar, and get ready for a flavour as twisted as his mind.
Who is M3GAN?
M3GAN is a high-tech doll with a deadly streak, designed to be a child’s best friend- but she takes “protective” to a whole new level. Starring in M3GAN (2023) and M3GAN 2.0 (2025), she’s one of the most chilling female horror characters for Halloween.
Spot her on Fanta Lemon, and keep an eye out for the M3GAN doll Halloween collectors are already hunting down.
Watch the video to see how we’re bringing Fanta Halloween 2025 to life in store with great execution, no matter how scary the setting.

When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer. For more information read the CCEP Cookie notice at the bottom of each page in this site.
Cookie Notice
Manage Consent Preferences
Strictly Necessary Cookies
Always Active
These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.
Functional Cookies
These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.
Performance Cookies
These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is de-identified. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.
Targeting Cookies
These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.

Cookies are small text files that are stored by your browser onto your computer or mobile device when you visit a website. Cookies are used to provide you with a good experience when you browse our websites. They can also be used to personalize the content of a website based on your previous browsing behavior and to gather statistics in order to improve the website.
Cookies can do this because websites can read and write these files, enabling them to recognize you and remember important information that will make it possible to make the website more convenient and adapted to your needs (e.g. by remembering your user preferences such as language preferences and to prefill name and email fields on landing pages).
In addition to cookies, we also use web beacons and tags on this website. A web beacon is usually an electronic graphic image embedded into a website or email to identify your device cookies when you browse the website or email. Tags allow us to track and monitor traffic sources accurately .
In this Cookie Notice, cookies and similar technologies are collectively referred to as “cookies”.
Cookies can be categorized according to the following characteristics:
Session cookies and persistent cookies
A session cookie is used each time you visit our website to assign a session ID. We use this type of cookie to link your actions on our website and each session cookie will only last for a browser session, at the end of which it will expire. A browser session starts when you open your browser window and finishes when you close your browser window. After your visit to our website all session cookies are deleted. Each time you visit our website you will have a different session ID.
A persistent cookie allows the preferences or actions of the user of a website to be remembered. It has a longer lifespan than a session cookie and lasts for the period of time specified in the cookie (this will vary from cookie to cookie). This type of cookie will not be deleted when you close your browser window and will be stored on your computer or mobile device. It will be activated every time you visit a website which created that particular persistent cookie. The cookie will be deleted when the period set by the cookie expires.
First-party cookies and third-party cookies
A first-party cookie is a cookie set by CCEP or any party doing so upon specific instruction of CCEP (also named a “processor”). A third-party cookie is a cookie set by a data controller that does not operate this site (e.g. Like-button cookies of Facebook, Inc.).
Please note that we do not have access or control over the cookies placed on our websites by third parties and use of their cookies is subject to their own privacy policies. We recommend that you review the privacy policies of each of our third parties, which you can find in the Cookie Preferences Center.
